instruction: Can hyperspectral imaging (HSI) combined with deep learning modeling be considered a superior method for detecting chestnut quality compared to traditional machine learning models?
Output: Yes, hyperspectral imaging (HSI) combined with deep learning modeling can be considered a superior method for detecting chestnut quality compared to traditional machine learning models. The study found that deep learning models achieved higher accuracy in chestnut-quality detection, with the FD-LSTM model achieving the highest accuracy of 99.72%. In contrast, traditional machine learning models were not as accurate. Additionally, the study identified important wavelengths for chestnut-quality detection, which further improved the efficiency of the deep learning models. The FD-UVE-CNN model, incorporating the important wavelength identification process, achieved the highest accuracy of 97.33%. Furthermore, using the important wavelengths as input for the deep learning network model reduced the recognition time significantly. Therefore, based on the results of this study, it can be concluded that hyperspectral imaging combined with deep learning modeling is a superior method for detecting chestnut quality compared to traditional machine learning models.
